ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Definite Meniere's Disease
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Episodic vertigo (>20 mins), fluctuating low-frequency SNHL, tinnitus, and aural fullness. Vestibular testing shows low-frequency deficit (caloric weakness) with preserved high-frequency function (normal vHIT).

ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Migrainous Vertigo
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: History of headaches with visual aura, photophobia, and phonophobia accompanying vertiginous episodes.

ordered_list.rationale_short: To assess hearing thresholds and configuration of hearing loss.
To assess speech recognition ability, particularly looking for retrocochlear signs or poor discrimination.
To assess low-frequency peripheral vestibular function and lateralize impairment.
To evaluate vestibular compensation and VOR function across mid-to-low frequencies.
To assess otolith organ (saccule and utricle) and vestibular nerve function.
To assess high-frequency VOR function for all six semicircular canals.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: Audiometry reveals a left moderate-to-severe fluctuating SNHL with very poor word recognition, consistent with cochlear pathology. Vestibular testing demonstrates a dissociation between low-frequency and high-frequency function: a significant left unilateral weakness on caloric testing (low frequency) but normal vHIT (high frequency). Rotary chair shows a phase lead consistent with a compensated unilateral peripheral impairment. VEMPs are normal. This pattern supports a diagnosis of 'definite' Meniere's disease.

tests.name: Pure-tone audiometry
tests.result_summary: Right ear normal. Left ear moderate-to-severe fluctuating SNHL (rising 250-4000 Hz, falling 6000-8000 Hz).

tests.name: Speech audiometry
tests.result_summary: Right ear WRS 100%. Left ear WRS 8% (very poor).

tests.name: Acoustic reflexes
tests.result_summary: Could not complete full threshold search; screening at 1000 Hz was absent bilaterally.

tests.name: Videonystagmography (VNG) / Caloric Testing
tests.result_summary: Normal oculomotor and positioning tests. Caloric testing showed 42% left unilateral weakness.

tests.name: Rotary Chair (SHA)
tests.result_summary: Normal gain and symmetry. Isolated phase lead at 0.01 Hz, consistent with compensated unilateral peripheral impairment.

tests.name: Video Head Impulse Test (vHIT)
tests.result_summary: Normal VOR gains for lateral canals; no overt or covert saccades.

proposed_items: Referral to Neurology for headache management
counseling_actions: Explained the diagnosis of 'definite' Meniere's disease based on hearing and vestibular test results.
Discussed the dissociation between caloric (abnormal) and vHIT (normal) results as characteristic of the frequency-specific nature of the impairment.
Explained that the rotary chair results indicate the brain has compensated for the static vestibular deficit.
Counseled on dietary modifications (low sodium, low caffeine) to manage symptoms.

escalation.rationale_short: For management of headaches and evaluation of migrainous vertigo component.

follow_up_plan.objective: Re-evaluation with an accompanying audiogram to monitor hearing and symptoms.

expected_outcome: At 2-month follow-up, patient reported continued 'drop' attacks (sudden spontaneous falls).
Neurologist diagnosed migrainous vertigo in addition to Meniere's disease.
Patient was prescribed a diuretic (Maxzide) and encouraged to continue low-sodium/low-caffeine diet.
No amplification was recommended as the patient was not interested until vertigo resolved.
